tldr: March quarter revenue was $95.4B (+5%) with EPS of $1.65 as services hit a record and iPhone returned to growth. Apple guided June-quarter revenue to low-to-mid single digits and gross margin to 45.5%-46.5%, including an estimated $900M tariff cost impact.
bullets: Revenue was $95.4B (+5% YoY) and EPS was $1.65 (+8% YoY) with services up 12% to $26.6B.
iPhone revenue rose 2% to $46.8B; iPad was up 15% while wearables were down 5%.
June quarter outlook: revenue low-to-mid single digits, gross margin 45.5%-46.5% with ~$900M tariff cost impact.
themes: Enterprise iPhone growth resumes with AI features
India sourcing shift improving enterprise supply resilience
Services momentum supports enterprise lifecycle value
Wearables softness tempers connected worker expansion

segments.title: iPhone
points: Revenue was $46.8B, up 2% YoY on iPhone 16 family demand.
iPhone install base and upgraders grew to all-time highs.

segments.title: Mac and iPad
points: Mac revenue grew 7% to $7.9B with M4 MacBook Air and Mac Studio updates.
iPad revenue grew 15% to $6.4B on new M3 iPad Air.

segments.title: Services
points: Revenue hit a record $26.6B, up 12% YoY with broad-based growth.
Services gross margin was 75.7% on favorable mix.

notes.title: Tariffs and supply chain
points: Estimated $900M cost impact for June quarter under current tariff assumptions.
Majority of U.S. iPhones expected to be sourced from India in June quarter.

notes.title: Capital return
points: Authorized additional $100B in share repurchases and raised dividend 4% to $0.26.
Returned $29B to shareholders in the quarter.

themes.title: Tariff mitigation
points: Apple plans continued supply chain optimization and inventory build-ahead where feasible.

themes.title: Apple Intelligence impact
points: Markets with Apple Intelligence rollout showed stronger iPhone performance.
Personalized Siri features require more time to meet quality standards.

top_questions.question: How large could tariff impacts be beyond June?
top_questions.summary: Management said it is difficult to project beyond June due to policy uncertainty.

top_questions.question: Is there evidence of demand pull-forward?
top_questions.summary: Apple saw no obvious evidence of a significant pull-forward in March quarter demand.

top_questions.question: What drove product gross margin decline?
top_questions.summary: Mix, seasonality, FX, and loss of leverage were the key drivers.

implications: Tariff exposure is manageable near-term but could pressure margins if policies shift.
India manufacturing expansion reduces U.S. tariff exposure over time.
competitive_notes: Services strength offsets hardware seasonality and FX headwinds.
forecast_hooks: Track June quarter tariff cost versus the $900M estimate.
Monitor Apple Intelligence language expansion effects on iPhone demand.

action_items: Validate India-sourced iPhone mix for U.S. shipments.
Watch for pricing actions if tariffs rise further.
open_questions: Timing for personalized Siri release beyond 2025.
Extent of EU DMA impact on services growth.
watch_next_quarter: June quarter revenue growth versus low-to-mid single digit guide.
Gross margin impact from tariff cost exposure.
